page.title: 05Cobbold's Point, Felixstowe
page.content: The coastline around Cobbold's Point has been attacked by{wave {erosion.}Also, many groynes or breakwaters have been placed along this stretch of the coastline. The barriers are here to stop the shingle being washed across the beach, because of the wave direction. Protection has been built in the form of a kind of concrete maze at {Jacob's Ladder.}This is to stop the grounds of Latimer House falling into the sea, as the cliffs were breaking away. Even now, the steps called Jacob's Ladder, which allow people to climb down to the beach are wearing away and it is becoming dangerous. Swimmers are{warned away}by notices which have been erected by the council, saying that it is not advisable to bathe as the currents are so dangerous.
